summary.para: The CreateOutputPin method creates a new output pin on the Demux.

param.name: pMediaType
param.para: Pointer to an structure that specifies the media type information for the new pin.

param.name: pszPinName
param.para: Pointer to a wide character string that specifies a name for the new pin. The maximum length is 128 characters, including the NULL terminator.

param.name: ppIPin
param.para: Address of a variable that receives a pointer to the pin's interface.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible return values include the following.

remarks.para: Duplicate pin names are not allowed. To configure the pin, query the returned interface for the interface (for program streams) or for the IMPEG2PIDMap interface (for transport streams). Depending on which interface is queried for on the first output pin, the Demux configures itself for either transport or program stream mode. Once the Demux is configured, any calls to QueryInterface to retrieve the other interface will fail.

summary.para: The DeleteOutputPin method deletes the specified output pin.

param.name: pszPinName
param.para: The friendly name of the pin as specified when the pin was created in a call to CreateOutputPin.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Call this method only when you need to delete a pin while keeping the filter alive. When the filter is released, it will perform all necessary cleanup on the output pins.

summary.para: The SetOutputPinMediaType method updates the media type of the specified output pin. (DirectX 9.0 and later.)

param.name: pszPinName
param.para: The friendly name of the pin as specified when the pin was created in a call to CreateOutputPin.

param.name: pMediaType
param.para: Pointer to an structure that specifies the new media type information for the pin.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful. If the method fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Pins can be reconfigured at any time with a new media type. If no connection exists, the media type is simply updated. If the pin is connected, the success or failure of the call will depend on the downstream input pin's acceptance or rejection of the specified media type.

The media type is not interpreted in any way by the Demultiplexer filter. It is used only during connection negotiation by the output pin. It has no effect on the content of the media samples. Media sample content is defined when a PID is mapped via the MEDIA_SAMPLE_CONTENT parameter in the IMPEG2PIDMap.MapPID method, or via the defined values in an call.

summary.para: This interface is implemented on the MPEG-2 Demultiplexer filter (Demux) and is used in both program stream mode and transport stream mode. It is called by applications or other filters to create, configure and delete output pins on the Demux. This interface is not exposed when the filter is playing back a file (pull-mode).
